alert.note: Alert for Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 8:48PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Washington Parish, southern Walthall, northern Harrison, northern Jackson and northern Pearl River Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 848 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of Richton to 6 miles east of Brooklyn to near Lumberton to near Tylertown. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Poplarville, Tylertown, Varnado, Saucier, Wade, Hurley, Big Point, Dexter, Vancleave and Angie. This includes Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 22 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southern Mississippi. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.
